episodes.title: #EXJW  Does Judgment + Comparison = Fear?
episodes.description:
One of my viewers wrote a letter explaining a rather odd behavior in her family. While her side of the family is not Jehovah’s Witness, her husband’s side was raised in the religion, but hubby was never active. She is very comfortable and relaxed with the immediate side of her own family and they freely express and interact with one another lovingly. On the other hand, when her hubby’s family members sporadically come around, she senses a very different feeling. She describes it as a stiffness, an artificiality, a feeling that she must watch herself. Why is that? Is it really true that JW religious judgment and comparison generates fear? I have a theory.

If you enjoyed this video like, subscribe, and click the notification bell.  I’ll see you next time.

I will be posting this video link to https://estherharrison.net/religious-judgment-and-comparison-generates-fear/

Watch Part 1 Dance World of My Dreams: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E29Yb...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VE7jQ...

episodes.title: #EXJW How I Got Disfellowshipped
episodes.description:
After one short announcement with my name in it, the process of getting disfellowshipping quite literally cut me off from my family. My kids were to cut me out of their lives. This happened a month after the death of my beloved mom, when I was still grieving over losing her. 
Blog: https://estherharrison.net/getting-disfellowshipped/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/_phoenixoffaith
